content: The module will have two parts ‚Äî first for students from class 3 to 8 and another one for students from class 9 to 12.

content: More than 50 houses were inundated, prompting the emergency relocation of people from the 13th and 11th blocks of the tribal rehabilitation area to the nearby Anganwadis and others to their relatives houses

title: In Tamil Nadu, kidney for sale

Serena Josephine M. and M. Sabari dive deep into the present circumstances to understand what needs to change

content: An official said due to heavy rains and rough weather, the boat toppled and started sinking, prompting the fishermen to jump into the water and start swimming to save themselves

title: What makes the NASA-ISRO NISAR satellite so special? | Explained
content: The three-tonne machine has been a decade in the making and costs more than $1.5 billion, making it one of the most expensive earth-observing satellites to date

title: Mahajan Commission report on Karnataka-Maharashtra border row is final, asserts H.K. Patil
content: Law and Parliamentary Affairs Minister H.K. Patil has said that there was no reason for Kannadigas to be concerned over cases pertaining to the Karnataka-Maharashtra border row before the Supreme Court, as it was a constitutional issue and no decision yet had been taken on taking up the case for hearing

content: A 20,000 sq.ft art and culture centre is being built by the couple at JP Nagar and it will be operational in about 18 months

content: The Finance Department has introduced Fund Information System (FIS) portal from financial year 2025-26 and it is mandatory to provide bank account details and FD details to get any financial assistance

title: West Bengal police launches helpline for migrant workers facing harassment in other States
content: The West Bengal police in the social media post said that the helpline number is¬†9147727666 which will be available only on WhatsApp and the people can send a message there with the necessary information, including your name and address.

title: Assam‚Äôs Foreigners‚Äô Tribunals disregard constitutional safeguards: report

title: Noida Girl Dies After BMW Rams Scooter. Father Was Taking Her To Hospital
content: A five-year-old girl died and two others were injured when a BMW luxury car hit a scooter in Noida Sector-20 late last night. Ironically, the crash took place when the two men on a scooter were taking the child to a hospital because she was unwell

title: On Camera, Leopard Lunges At Moving Bike In Andhra, He Escapes Unhurt
content: The harrowing event was captured by a dashcam in a car trailing behind, and the video has since gone viral on social media.

title: 2 Critically Injured In High-Speed Collision On Mumbai-Agra Highway
content: A horrific accident took place on the Mumbai-Agra Highway in Maharashtra's Dhule district, involving a high-speed trolley and a truck. The incident, which occurred near a speed breaker, was captured in its entirety on a CCTV camera.

title: 4 Minors Tied, Beaten And Paraded Over Theft Of 25 Kg Peas In Bihar
content: Four children were tied with ropes, beaten and paraded through a village in Bihar's Munger after being accused of stealing 25 kg of peas.

title: NIA Files Chargesheet Against Tamil Nadu Man In ISIS Radicalisation Case
content: A Alfasith, hailing from Mayiladuthurai, Tamil Nadu, has been named as an accused in a charge sheet filed before a NIA special court, Poonamalle (TN).

title: 3 Fishermen Missing, 5 Escape As Boat Sinks In Sea In Maharashtra
content: The incident occurred around 8.30 am off Khanderi when the boat from Karanja in Uran had gone for fishing in the sea near Alibaug.

title: Born At 6 Pounds, Died At 4: Gaza Mother's Final Kiss To Her Starving Infant
content: A mother pressed a final kiss to what remained of her 5-month-old daughter and wept. Esraa Abu Halib's baby now weighed less than when she was born.

title: India-Pakistan Clash In Asia Cup Stirs Political Row Months After Pahalgam Attack
content: An upcoming India-Pakistan cricket face-off scheduled just months after border tension and a ghastly terror attack has stirred a political controversy in the country.

title: 16-Year-Old Boy Crashes Father's Car, Kills E-Rickshaw Driver In Delhi
content: The teenage boy was accompanied by his younger sister, a senior police officer said, adding that after losing control, the car overturned and crashed into an e-rickshaw.

title: UP Minister's Big Warning To Power Officials, Akhilesh Yadav's "Wires" Quip
content: Top officials in the Uttar Pradesh electricity department are not receiving distress calls from the public during power supply disruptions, the power minister has said

title: Turkey Records All-Time High Temperature of 50.5 Degrees Celsius
content: Turkey's environment ministry said Saturday that meteorologists had registered a reading of 50.5C in the southeast of the country, a nationwide record.

title: Trump's Latest Meme Attack Depicts Obama in OJ Simpson And The White Ford Bronco Police Chase
content: US President Donald Trump has once again taken a jab at former President Barack Obama and this time, using one of the world's most infamous police chases.

title: "Hand Was Hanging By Thread": Indian-Origin Man Attacked In Australia
content: An Indian-origin man was brutally attacked with a machete by a group of teenagers while he was on his way home from a pharmacy in Australia's Melbourne last week.

title: Siddaramaiah Has Done More For Mysuru Than Iconic King Krishnaraja Wodeyar: Son
content: Even as talk of a leadership change in Karnataka is yet to completely die down, Congress Member of Legislative Council and Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's son Yathindra Siddaramaiah has given his father a huge endorsement.

title: Fire, Smoke On Runway Before Takeoff, Dramatic Footage Shows Evacuation
content: An American Airlines flight was forced to abort take-off at Denver airport on Saturday after a landing gear malfunction that led to fire and smoke.

title: Israel Resumes Airdrop Aid To Gaza Amid Backlash Over Deepening Hunger Crisis
content: Israel said on Saturday that it air dropped aid into the Gaza Strip and would open humanitarian corridors, as it faced growing international condemnation over the deepening hunger crisis in the Palestinian territory.

title: EPS Welcomes PM Modi In Trichy, Sends Key Demands Amid BJP-AIADMK Alliance Reset
content: The meeting came against the backdrop of a simmering war of words between the allies over the nature of a possible National Democratic Alliance (NDA) government in Tamil Nadu, should the coalition win in 2026.

title: "KTR Offered To Merge With Us If...": BJP MP's Big Claim
content: BJP MP CM Ramesh has alleged that BRS Working President KT Rama Rao (KTR) had offered to have an alliance or to merge the BRS with the BJP on the condition that ongoing ED and CBI probes against his sister, K Kavitha, would be halted.

title: Mass Stabbing At Michigan Walmart Leaves 11 Injured, Suspect In Custody
content: At least 11 people were stabbed at a Walmart in Traverse City on Saturday - with six in critical condition - in what the sheriff said appeared to be a random act. A suspect was in custody, authorities said.

title: Congress targets government over ‚Äòorganic cotton scam‚Äô, demands probe
content: Congress leader Digvijay Singh alleged that there has been a ‚Çπ2.1 lakh crore scam involving ‚Äòfake‚Äô organic cotton and some traders have made six-fold profits; he demanded an investigation into the matter

title: Revanth calls for revival of ideology-driven politics, recalls Jaipal Reddy‚Äôs contribution to politics¬†
content: Chief Minister recalled the political and administrative reforms initiated by Jaipal Reddy during his tenure as Union Minister

title: Study recommends two half-dose combination of drugs in a single pill for good blood pressure control in Indians
content: All three combinations, in patients aged 30‚Äì79, delivered equivalent BP reductions and similar rates of BP control, researchers said; all combinations were equally safe and effective with high tolerability over six months, they wrote in the paper

title: Air India disburses interim compensation to families of Ahmedabad crash victims
content: Compensation paid to kin of 166 victims; process under way for remaining 52; airline sets up memorial trust

content: Trinamool Congress MP and chairperson of West Bengal Migrant Welfare Board Samirul Islam on Saturday says a witch-hunt is going on against migrants in the name of ‚ÄòBangladeshis‚Äô

title: Tej Pratap Yadav to contest Bihar Assembly election as independent candidate from Mahua
content: Following a recent controversy involving a video of his relationship with a woman, RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav‚Äôs elder son was expelled from the party, and ousted from his family

content: Prime Minister Modi launches multiple projects in Tamil Nadu, including new airport terminal, extended runway, and cargo berthing facility

title: Thiruvananthapuram DCC president Palode Ravi resigns after leaked phone call embarrasses party¬†
content: The discussion about the possibility of the LDF returning to power again in 2026 and the BJP striking deeper, making electoral gains in the Assembly elections, puts the Congress on the defensive. The tape also had disparaging predictions¬†about¬†the Congress faring poorly in the local body polls later this year

title: Reports on officials, religion, protests land journalists in trouble; those in towns most impacted, finds study
content: A study said that a journalist‚Äôs experience of the justice system differed based on location and status. Journalists in major metropolises were arrested in 24% of the incidents, this increased to 58% for journalists in small cities and towns.

title: Defending need for SIR in the Supreme Court, Election Commission cites parties‚Äô complaints about voter list errors
content: In its counter affidavit filed in the SC, the ECI cites complaints made by AAP, Congress, BJP, AIADMK, Shiv Sena; ECI says it began the SIR ‚Äúto restore puiblic confidence in the integrity of the electoral roll‚Äù

title: Closely monitoring situation: India on Thailand-Cambodia clashes
content: The Indian mission in the Thai capital urged all Indian travellers to check updates from authorities in the country before visiting tourist attractions in troubled areas.

title: State Election Commission gets over 1 lakh applications for fresh enrolment on voters list in the first three days
content: State Election Commission Commission has given time till August 7 for the public to include their names, rectify errors or make changes in the entries

title: T.N. Forest Dept. restores unused stretch of intertidal barren land along Uppanar River in Cuddalore
content: Steps have been initiated to form a Village Mangrove Committee at Kudikadu to further strengthen local participation and protective mechanisms, says B. Iqbal, Forest Range Officer. This committee will involve local stakeholders in protection, maintenance, and awareness activities related to the mangrove ecosystem

title: Issue guidelines within three months for safe collection, transport of medical samples, Delhi HC tells Centre
content: Currently, India lacks specific regulations governing how medical samples, such as blood, urine, or swabs, are collected, stored, and transported to diagnostic laboratories, a regulatory gap that has led to serious concerns

title: Houses damaged as trees fall on them in heavy rain in Thrissur
content: District administration opens three relief camps, where 132 people from 33 families are currently housed. Authorities asked to take pre-emptive measures against landslides and manage dam openings with utmost caution

title: Rajasthan govt. announces ‚Çπ10 lakh each to kin of children killed in Jhalawar school building collapse
content: CM Bhajan Lal Sharma also announced an increase from 15% to 20% in the permissible allocation for these buildings in the Dang, Magra and Mewat regions.

title: NBA execs debate the rookie class: Flagg runaway ROY? Biggest steal?
content: the 2025 draft has wrapped up, with the rookie class debuting at summer leagues and teams looking ahead to next season . we polled 20 anonymous executives and scouts, asking for their thoughts on the draft and what teams are expecting from their new faces .

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: all but seven NHL teams have at least $1 million to spend on their rosters . 11 teams have north of $10 million of cap space . the unrestricted pool is essentially a shallow creek with very few impactful free agents .

title: Clash of Clans Summer Jam offers players the chance to join Travis Hunter's team
content: Supercell has announced that it has partnered with Travis Hunter for the summer jam . the event is designed to help players get their villages back into shape . Hunter is a highly respected athlete, but also an active Clash of Clans player . it is set to last until Aug. 1 .

title: Power Rankings entering Week 9: Outlaws, Atlas stay on top
content: the premier lacrosse league will be in Salt Lake City this week for week 9 of the regular season . the top three in the standings remains steady, but there's some movement in the middle of the pack . current record: 5-2 Previous ranking: 1 The Outlaws are the league's hottest team .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Summer storylines for all 32 teams
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on how strong each team will be in the 2025-26 season . this edition includes the top storyline for each team during the summer break, which generates our master list .

title: Wiegman, the major tournament magician, is in yet another final. How does she do it?
content: england manager Sarina Wiegman will lead the team to the euro 2025 final on sunday . she will face switzerland in the final on saturday night . toone says she finds it awkward, but there is no sense of self . he says she believes everyone plays his or her part in the success .

title: ‚ÄòPower line fell on crowd‚Äô: What triggered stampede at Haridwar temple; 8 dead
content: Tragedy struck at the Mansa Devi temple in Haridwar, where a stampede claimed the lives of at least six people. The incident occurred amidst a large gathering of devotees. District Magistrate Mayur Dixit confirmed the fatalities, while Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami expressed his condolences and assured full support.

title: 'Hand hanging by thread': Indian-origin man attacked by gang with machete in Melbourne
content: Saurabh Anand, an Indian-origin man, was brutally attacked by a teen machete gang in Melbourne, resulting in severe injuries. The attack occurred at Central Square Shopping Centre in Altona Meadows, leaving Anand with a severed hand, head injuries, and broken bones. Doctors managed to reattach his hand after extensive surgery, while several teenagers were arrested in connection with the assault.

title: Bengaluru heist in 18 seconds: Armed robbers threaten staff at gunpoint
content: In a swift 18-second heist, three masked individuals, one brandishing a gun, robbed Sri Ram Jewellers in Madanayakanahalli, Bengaluru Rural, late Friday night. The perpetrators made off with 150 grams of gold ornaments, as the shop owner and his associate were preparing to secure the items for the night.

title: Mann ki Baat: PM Modi hails Shubhanshu Shukla and Chandrayaan 3; top quotes from 124th episode
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his 124th Mann ki Baat episode, highlighted India's achievements in science and culture. He mentioned astronaut Sudhanshu Shukla's return from the International Space Station and the excitement surrounding Chandrayaan-3's success. PM Modi also noted the rise of space startups and announced August 23 as National Space Day, inviting suggestions via the Namo App.

title: China moves ahead with its mega dam project - Will India's response face local resistance?
content: Tensions escalate in the Eastern Himalayas as India and China pursue massive dam projects on the Brahmaputra River. Local communities in Arunachal Pradesh resist India's Siang Upper Multipurpose Project, fearing environmental damage and displacement. The project is a strategic response to China's dam construction upstream, raising concerns about water diversion and regional stability.

title: AI in medicine: OpenAI CEO says bots beat doctors at diagnosis; yet people prefer humans
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman stated that AI, like ChatGPT, often surpasses human doctors in diagnostic accuracy. Despite this, people still prefer human doctors, highlighting the importance of trust in healthcare. Altman also warned about an impending fraud crisis due to AI's ability to mimic voices, rendering current voice authentication methods obsolete.

title: Heavy rainfall lashes parts of Mumbai; IMD issues red & orange alerts
content: Mumbai experienced heavy rainfall, prompting a yellow alert from the IMD, while Raigad was under an orange alert. In Madhya Pradesh, torrential rains caused the Narmada River to overflow, submerging a bridge and disrupting traffic. Red alerts for intense rainfall and lightning were issued for several districts across Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, and Goa.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Wrapped in cotton wool' - Ex-England batter on why Stokes didn't bowl
content: Doubts surround captain Ben Stokes' absence from England's bowling attack on Day 4 of the fourth Test against India at Old Trafford, despite his earlier century. Former England batter Jonathan Trott suggests medical advice might be the reason behind Stokes' non-participation, considering his history of injuries and the upcoming Ashes tour.

title: Noida shocker: 5-year-old girl killed as speeding BMW car rams into two-wheeler
content: In a tragic incident in Noida's Sector 30, a 5-year-old girl died after a BMW collided with a scooty on Saturday night. The collision also left two others critically injured. Noida Police have arrested two students, Yash Sharma and Abhishek Rawat, in connection with the accident, and the involved BMW has been seized.

title: China's BYD to assemble EVs in Pakistan; VP BYD Pakistan says, 'Do not forsee...'
content: BYD is planning to launch its first Pakistan-assembled car by July or August 2026, aiming to capitalize on the growing demand for electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles. The plant, a joint venture with Mega Motor Company, will initially produce 25,000 units annually, focusing on the domestic market with potential exports to right-hand drive countries.

title: Huge crowd at Haridwar's Mansa Devi temple leads to stampede
content: A tragic stampede at the Mansa Devi temple in Haridwar on Sunday resulted in the death of at least six people and injuries to several others. The incident occurred on the staircase leading to the temple, triggered by a massive influx of pilgrims during the month of Shravan. Rescue operations are underway, with authorities closely monitoring the situation.

title: ‚ÄòDressed as priest‚Äô: YouTuber with 5 million followers arrested in UP
content: Mohd Aamir, a YouTuber from Moradabad with over 5 million subscribers, was arrested for allegedly uploading objectionable content. Accused of producing abusive and propagandist videos while dressed as a priest, Aamir faces charges including promoting enmity and public mischief. After securing bail, he apologized, stating his videos were for entertainment and promised to refrain from such content.

title: 'The No.3 conundrum is back': Ex-cricketer flags India‚Äôs batting-order concern
content: India's No.3 batting position remains a concern after Sai Sudharsan's recent struggles, including a golden duck. Aakash Chopra highlights the ongoing search for a stable performer in that crucial spot, despite other batting positions being adequately filled by KL Rahul and Shubman Gill. Previous attempts with Karun Nair also proved unsuccessful, leaving the No.3 problem unresolved.

title: Jeff Bezos sells $1.5 billion worth of Amazon shares, holds stock valued at...
content: Jeff Bezos recently sold 6.6 million Amazon shares worth $1.5 billion, as per an SEC filing. The sales occurred on July 21 and 22, before Amazon's Q2 earnings report. These transactions were executed under a prearranged 10b5-1 trading plan. Bezos intends to sell more shares, potentially up to 25 million by May 2026. He has already sold $4.

title: 'Josh was truly high': Shubhanshu Shukla‚Äôs wife shares behind-the-scenes
content: Shubhanshu Shukla made history as the first Indian astronaut on the ISS, enduring six launch delays that tested his family's resolve. His wife, Kamna, shared the emotional journey, from initial excitement to cautious hope, culminating in a successful launch on June 25. After an 18-day scientific mission, Shukla returned to Earth, sharing his awe and national pride.

title: Woman in Audi ‚Äòusing Google Map‚Äô falls into creek in Navi Mumbai; rescued just in time
content: A 29-year-old woman, Shweta Sharma, driving to Ulwe, mistakenly followed the road to Belapur creek jetty in heavy rain and darkness. Her car plunged into the creek, but coastal security police rescued her. She mentioned using Google Maps and getting confused by the directions, leading her to drive towards the jetty instead of the bridge.

title: ‚ÄòJudgmental‚Äô: Tanushree Dutta slams trolls for criticizing her mutton consumption
content: Tanushree Dutta defended eating mutton after her Shravan fast, citing Bengali customs and Ayurveda. Facing backlash, she urged respect for cultural differences. She emphasized diet‚Äôs role in mental health and dismissed accusations, calling critics ‚Äúmentally unstable.‚Äù Her flexible fasting approach blends spirituality with nutrition for overall well-being.

title: ‚ÄòLike Krishna vs Kaliya‚Äô: 2-year-old boy in Bihar bites cobra to death
content: In a shocking incident in Bettiah, West Champaran, a two-year-old boy, Govinda Kumar, remarkably killed a cobra by biting it after the snake coiled around his hands. The child lost consciousness due to the venom but survived after prompt medical intervention. Doctors at GMCH Bettiah are closely monitoring Govinda, whose condition is now stable.

title: Asteroid as big as an airplane to pass Earth: Here‚Äôs all you need to know
content: On July 28, 2025, asteroid 2025 OW, about 210 feet across, will pass Earth at a safe distance of 393,000 miles. NASA assures there's no threat, as such close approaches are routine. While invisible to the naked eye, it highlights NASA's planetary defense efforts, with a more visible pass by asteroid Apophis expected in 2029.

title: 'England will have just enough': Experts agree hosts hold edge on final day in Manchester
content: Despite a resilient fightback from India captain Shubman Gill and veteran batter KL Rahul, former cricketers Michael Vaughan and Dinesh Karthik believe England hold the edge heading into the final day of the fourth Test against India. India ended Day 4 at 174/2, with rain expected to play a significant role.

title: American Airlines passengers flee via slides as smoke engulfs plane
content: An American Airlines flight bound for Miami aborted takeoff at Denver International Airport due to a landing gear malfunction. Dramatic footage showed passengers evacuating via emergency slides as smoke and flames erupted from the aircraft's rear. The airline identified a tyre issue on the Boeing 737 MAX 8.

title: Minor held for rape of classmate in school washroom in central Delhi
content: In Delhi, a 14-year-old boy was allegedly sexually assaulted in a school washroom, leading to the apprehension of a classmate. The incident, reported on July 24th, prompted police investigation, medical examination, and counselling for the survivor.

title: Tigress that killed 5 villagers in Pilibhit ‚Äògets life‚Äô in Kanpur zoo
content: A three-and-a-half-year-old tigress, suspected of fatally attacking five individuals in Pilibhit, Uttar Pradesh, between May and July, has been relocated to the Kanpur zoo. After a week-long rescue operation, the tigress was captured and deemed healthy, but officials determined that releasing her back into the wild posed too great a risk due to her habit of venturing into populated areas.

title: 22-vehicle pile-up on Mumbai-Pune e-way kills 1
content: A tragic accident on the Pune-Mumbai Expressway resulted in the death of a 58-year-old woman and injuries to 18 others after a trailer truck's brakes failed, causing it to ram into 22 vehicles. The incident led to significant traffic delays, with emergency services responding to assist the injured, who were transported to nearby hospitals for treatment.

title: Shubman Gill breaks Kohli's massive SENA record, eyes more history in Manchester
content: India captain Shubman Gill's stellar form continued in England as he surpassed Virat Kohli's record for most runs by an Indian batter on a single SENA tour, amassing 697 runs in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. He also became the second-highest run-scoring Indian Test captain in a series, trailing only Sunil Gavaskar.

title: Model Ruchi Gujjar slaps ‚ÄòSo Long Valley‚Äô producer Karan Singh at movie premiere
content: Mumbai Police have registered an FIR against Karan Singh, the producer of 'So Long Valley,' for allegedly defrauding model Ruchi Gujjar of Rs 23 lakh. Gujjar claims Singh promised her a stake in a television movie project, including profit share and on-screen credit, but the project never materialized, and the money was not returned.

title: 'Why boycott WCL but play Pakistan in Asia Cup?': Ex-Pak cricketer questions India
content: Danish Kaneria has ignited controversy by questioning India's participation in the Asia Cup 2025, contrasting it with their earlier withdrawal from the World Championship of Legends against Pakistan due to national sentiment. He accuses India of inconsistency, suggesting that if playing Pakistan is acceptable now, the WCL should have been as well.

title: Chris Gayle's record broken! Rovman Powell becomes West Indies' second-highest T20I run-getter
content: Rovman Powell surpassed Chris Gayle to become West Indies' second-highest T20I run-scorer during the fourth T20I against Australia, reaching 1,925 runs. Despite Powell's 28-run contribution, West Indies posted 205/9, which Australia chased down successfully, led by Josh Inglis and Cameron Green, securing a 4-0 series lead. The final T20I is set for Monday.

title: Caroline Wozniacki & David Lee welcome baby Max: 'Our family couldn‚Äôt be happier'
content: Caroline Wozniacki and David Lee welcomed their third child, Max Wozniacki Lee, on July 26th. The tennis star shared a heartwarming photo of her older children, Olivia and James, cradling their new baby brother. Wozniacki hinted at the pregnancy earlier this year and her tennis future remains uncertain as she focuses on her growing family.

title: Tortured, locked up for 8 days: Dubai travel agent kidnapped in Bengaluru
content: A Dubai-based travel manager, Lawrence Melwin, was abducted in Bengaluru after being lured by a woman named Mahima. He was assaulted, robbed of ‚Çπ1 lakh and iPhones, and held for ransom, initially demanded at ‚Çπ50 lakh, later escalating to ‚Çπ2.5 crore. Melwin's cries for help led to his rescue and the arrest of four accomplices.

title: Happy National Parents' Day 2025: 75+ wishes, images, messages to share
content: National Parents' Day 2025, celebrated on July 27th, offers a chance to honor parents' unwavering love and support. It's a day to acknowledge their role in raising children and express gratitude through heartfelt messages and gestures. Whether near or far, simple acts like sharing memories, sending thoughtful notes, or even a quick call can make parents feel appreciated.

title: 'Declare meats, fruits, vegetables': Travelers to US get weird reminder from CBP
content: U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) is reminding travelers to declare meats, fruits, vegetables, and other agricultural items upon entry to the United States. Recent incidents of non-compliance have led to penalties for travelers. A TikToker faced a potential fine for forgetting to declare a banana, highlighting the importance of adhering to CBP regulations to avoid confiscation and fines.

title: TN polls: EPS meets PM Modi in Trichy; first meet since alliance renewed
content: Edappadi K Palaniswami welcomed Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Trichy, sparking speculation about a potential AIADMK-BJP alliance despite past disagreements. This meeting, the first since their renewed ties, occurs amidst conflicting statements regarding a coalition government in the lead-up to the 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly elections, with EPS asserting AIADMK's independent victory.

title: Microphone blunder! Nasser Hussain roasts Dinesh Karthik on-air
content: Nasser Hussain playfully teased Dinesh Karthik for a microphone mishap during a tea break at the fourth Test. Karthik, now a commentator and batting coach for Royal Challengers Bengaluru, was reminded of the importance of his equipment. On the field, India recovered from an early collapse thanks to Shubman Gill and KL Rahul's strong partnership after England's imposing first-innings total.

title: Who is Gaza journalist Aoun and why did he put his camera, press shield on sale?
content: A Gaza-based photojournalist is resorting to selling his equipment to feed his family amidst a looming famine. ‚Äã "I am the photojournalistMohammed Abu Aoun from Gaza, I want to offer my equipment and the press shield for sale so that I can buy food for me and my family," his LinkedIn post read.

title: First time in 55 years! Gill, Rahul script history for India in Test cricket
content: Shubman Gill and KL Rahul etched their names in history, becoming the first Indian pair in 55 years to surpass 500 runs each in an away Test series, emulating Sunil Gavaskar and Dilip Sardesai's 1970-71 feat. Their resilient partnership against England at Old Trafford offered India hope after an early collapse.

title: Cambodia-Thailand conflict: Heavy shelling continues; both signal openness to talks
content: A fierce border conflict between Cambodia and Thailand has escalated, resulting in significant casualties and displacement. International concern has grown, prompting intervention from US President Donald Trump, who urged both nations to agree to a ceasefire. The clashes, fueled by territorial disputes and political tensions, have led to widespread calls for peace and bilateral dialogue to resolve the conflict.

title: Government tells Air India to 'end backseat driving' in key departments
content: Following safety concerns and a recent incident, the aviation ministry has urged Air India to eliminate "backseat driving" in critical departments. The ministry emphasized that designated post-holders must have the final decision-making authority, ensuring accountability and preventing them from becoming scapegoats. The government is committed to supporting Air India in overcoming its challenges and achieving its potential, drawing on the expertise of Singapore Airlines.

title: Travis Kelce posts Taylor Swift photo dump: 13‚Äëpic carousel sparks buzz
content: Travis Kelce's recent Instagram post, featuring cozy moments with Taylor Swift, signals a deepening relationship. The NFL star shared 13 photos, marking the first time he's publicly displayed their romance on his personal account. Insiders confirm the move was intentional, showcasing how serious things have become as they navigate fame and love.

title: Asia Cup: How India and Pakistan could clash three times in UAE showdown
content: The Asia Cup 2025 schedule has been released, with the UAE hosting the T20 tournament from September 9-28. India and Pakistan are in Group A, setting up a highly anticipated clash on September 14. Given their strength, they are expected to qualify for the Super 4s and potentially the final, leading to a possible three encounters between the rivals.

title: 'Messi Cam' Returns: MLS, TikTok to stream exclusive player-focused broadcasts again
content: Lionel Messi will once again be the focus of MLS's innovative 'Messi Cam,' a dedicated livestream tracking his every move during Inter Miami's Leagues Cup match against Necaxa on August 2. Available on TikTok in a mobile-friendly format, this 'Player Spotlight' initiative, in collaboration with TikTok and Apple TV, aims to elevate fan engagement.

title: Has Arsenal created another goalkeeper conundrum?
content: Kepa Arrizabalaga joined arsenal from Valencia in a surprise move . the spaniard spent the 2023-24 campaign at real madrid . he was ostensibly a replacement for Thibaut Courtois after a knee injury .

title: How Jen Welter‚Äôs hiring by the Cardinals has changed the NFL landscape for women
content: a decade ago, when she was 12, she was her first love . her father, former Div. III player Lawyer Wilson, Jr., taught her the game . she is entering her second season as an assistant coach with the Buffalo Bills .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid not giving up on Arsenal's Saliba
content: Eddie Howe discusses the future of Alexander Isak . al Hilal have offered him a huge salary to ward off interest from Liverpool . real madrid continue to covet William Saliba despite arsenal's resistance .
